instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA: What is PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA? PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA is a 3.3 volt power rail that powers the camera. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that had some spillage after repair and ultrasonic and test I dont have any camera. 

J4200 has 
0v on pins 2 and 3  (.324 on diode mode)
pin 4 has 0v and reads short to ground this doesnt change when you access camera.
PIns 5 and 6 0v (.318 on diode).
PIn 8 and 9 have 3.3v
Pin 10 and 11 have 1.7v
Pin 12 have 5v

<SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN_PCH</SIGNAL>    is present 
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA</SIGNAL>  is present

I have also tried this with a known good screen and camera. Are BCM15700 a known issue onthis model or is there something else Im missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
threads.message:
Did you check CONTINUITY of these coils?

Compare voltage and diode mode readings on data lines with known good working board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
threads.message: Yes continuity on both are fine and diode readings are same as good board .325

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
threads.message:
Check if working board has some voltage on these lines, when webcam connected.
Also try known good working BIOS; test cleaning original ME region first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing webcam
threads.message:
I already had clean Me region bios from here to test but same issue
I am getting no waveforms on <SIGNAL>MIPI_DATA_CONN</SIGNAL> but am getting one on the good test board.

When inject 3v into <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA</SIGNAL> both <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> get warm I also noticed thunderbolt external video does not work aswell as the webcam.

I removed <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> snd <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> as they were getting very hot to touch and then replaced <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> from scrap board but still not getting external video . I haven't worked on an issue like this Thunderbolt any pointer would be appreciated (I had thunderbolt adapater in and hdmi cable to tv)
